title: T-Mobile opens beta for Starlink smartphone connectivity
summary:
T-Mobile has opened beta registration for Starlink’s direct-to-smartphone satellite service, enabling text messaging early next year on select newer devices in most U.S. cellular dead zones with a clear sky view.
The post T-Mobile opens beta for Starlink smartphone connectivity appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA releases long-term strategy for robotic Mars exploration
summary:
NASA has refined its strategy for future robotic exploration of Mars, advocating for a regular cadence of smaller missions to answer key questions in advance of human missions.
The post NASA releases long-term strategy for robotic Mars exploration appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Artemis II Core Stage Moves to High Bay 2
summary: In this image from Dec. 11, 2024, the 212-foot-tall SLS (Space Launch System) core stage is lowered into High Bay 2 at the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. title: Starlink set to hit $11.8 billion revenue in 2025, boosted by military contracts
summary:
Quilty Space in a new report says the U.S. government contract awarded SpaceX a $537 million contract for Starlink services for Ukraine’s military

title: Europe Allocates €10.6B to Build and Launch IRIS2 Constellation
summary:
The European Space Agency and the European Commission have signed a contract with the SpaceRIDE consortium to develop and launch the IRIS2 secure communications constellation. In late October, the European Commission announced that it had accepted the “best-and-final offer” from the SpaceRIDE consortium for the development of its Infrastructure for Resilience, Interconnectivity, and Security by […]
The post Europe Allocates €10.6B to Build and Launch IRIS2 Constellation appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Station Science Top News: Dec. 13, 2024
summary: Benchmarks for solidifying metal alloys Researchers report benchmark data for modeling the growth of specific types of microstructures that form during solidification of metal alloys under different conditions. These microstructures affect the properties of materials and products such as refrigeration devices and solar cells. The ESA (European Space Agency) Columnar-to-Equiaxed Transition in Solidification Processing (CETSOL) […]

title: NASA Sees Progress on Starlab Commercial Space Station Development
summary: A NASA-funded commercial space station, Starlab, recently completed four key developmental milestones, marking substantial progress in the station’s design and operational readiness. The four milestones are part of a NASA Space Act Agreement  awarded in 2021 and focused on reviews of the habitat structural test article preliminary design, systems integration, integrated operations, and a habitat […]

title: NASA Finalizes Strategy for Sustaining Human Presence in Low Earth Orbit
summary: As part of the agency’s efforts to enable broader use of space, NASA has released its final goals and objectives for low Earth orbit, defining the long-term approach toward advancing microgravity science, technology, and exploration for the benefit of all. title: Celebrating 20 Years: Night Sky Network
summary: by Vivan White & Kat Troche of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific NASA’s Night Sky Network is one of the most successful and longstanding grassroots initiatives for public engagement in astronomy education.
